com.percussion.util
Class PSUrlUtils

java.lang.Object
  com.percussion.util.PSUrlUtils

public class PSUrlUtils
extends Object

A utility class that contains methods useful for processing URLs. All methods are static as it is never meant to be instantiated.

Method Summary

Method Detail

createUrl

public static String createUrl(String base,
                               Iterator queryParams,
                               String anchor)
Builds a URL from its parts. The parts are combined in this way:

base?p1=v1&p2=v2#anchor

where pN is the Nth parameter and vN is the Nth value

Parameters:
base - The root part of the URL. May contain a query string, and/or anchor. All parameters and the anchor must be url-encoded. The root part must not be null or empty.
queryParams - A set of Map.Entry objects, each of which contains a param name (String) as the key and the param value (String) as the value. If the key is null, the entry is ignored. The value may be null. If null, no query string is added. The params are added after any params already in the base part.
anchor - The anchor text. Only appended if not null and not empty. If the base had an anchor, it is replaced by this one. Handles presence of anchor seperator.
Returns:
The fully formed url as a String. Never null. If the base has an anchor and an anchor is supplied, the supplied anchor replaces the anchor in the base.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if base is null, empty or only contains query and/or anchor.

createUrl

public static URL createUrl(String host,
                            Integer port,
                            String partialUrl,
                            Iterator queryParams,
                            String anchor,
                            IPSRequestContext request)
                     throws MalformedURLException
Convenience method that calls createUrl(host, port, partialUrl, queryParams, anchor, request, true)

Throws:
MalformedURLException - if any of the pieces can't be converted to a URL.
See Also:
createUrl(String, Integer, String, Iterator, String, IPSRequestContext, boolean)

createUrl

public static URL createUrl(String host,
                            Integer port,
                            String partialUrl,
                            Iterator queryParams,
                            String anchor,
                            IPSRequestContext request,
                            boolean allowHttps)
                     throws MalformedURLException
Creates a URL from the supplied parameters and returns it. Will optionally create the url to use the HTTPS protocol if the supplied request context resulted from an HTTPS request.

A URI has the following pieces for purposes of this description (see RFC 2396 for more details):

<scheme>://<host><path-segments> <resource>?<query>#<fragment>

All parts except resource are optional.

Five basic forms are allowed for the supplied URI:

  • Fully qualified (e.g. http://server:9992/Rhythmyx/approot/res.html
  • Partially qualified (e.g. /Rhythmyx/approot/res.html)
  • Relative (e.g. ../myApp/res.html)
  • Resource name only (e.g. res.html)
  • An empty string.

Any of these forms may contain a query and fragment part. Any relative url is assumed to be relative from the orginating request's app root.

If the supplied URL is fully qualified and the protocol is not 'http(s)', the supplied URL will be returned, unmodified. Otherwise, any pieces supplied will be used in the result. If the supplied URL is not fully qualified, the missing parts will be added as follows:

  • For a partially qualified name, the http(s) protocol, server and port will be added to the supplied name.
  • For an unqualified name, those same items plus the Rhythmyx request root and the originating application request root will be added.
  • For a relative name, original request protocol (http or https), server, port, and Rhythmyx root will be added, assuming it is relative to the origination application's request root.
  • For an empty string, all parts of the originating request will be used, substituting the supplied parameters. If the port is 80 and http is being used, no port number will be added to the generated url. If server and port are not provided, they will come from the current session, subject to the value of the useSecure parameter (see that parameter's documentation for more info).

Parameters:
host - The hostname to use. May be null. If not specified, the hostname of the originating request will be used.
port - The port to use. May be null. If not specified, the port of the originating request will be used, subject to the value of the useSecure parameter (see that parameter's documentation for more info). If specified, it will always be used regardless of the value of other parameters.
partialUrl - As much or as little of the URL as you wish to specify. Supplied pieces will be filled in as specified above. If a null or empty string is provided, then the request url that generated the current request (up through the request page) will be used. If a relative URL is specified, it is assumed to be relative to the originating request app root. Any query parameters in the url must be url-encoded and are retained.
queryParams - A set of Map.Entry objects, each of which contains a param name (String) as the key and the param value (String) as the value. If the key is null, the entry is ignored. The value may be null. If null, no query string is added. The params are added after any params already in the base part.
anchor - The anchor text. Only appended if not null and not empty. If the base had an anchor, it is replaced by this one. Handles presence of anchor seperator.
request - The request context of the originating request. May not be null.
allowHttps - Indicates whether to allow the https protocol. If true, then https will be used if either the originating request used https or if the supplied partialUrl specifies the https protocol. The following table shows the resulting protocol used based on combinations of input parameter values. Note: if the port parameter is not null, that value will be used regardless of the other parameter values.

The table below shows the resulting protocol from various combinations of parameter values.

allowHttpsOriginal Request Protocol partialUrl protocolResulting protocol Notes
falseHTTPnoneHTTP 
falseHTTPSnoneHTTPuse Rx server's default port
trueHTTPnoneHTTP 
trueHTTPSnoneHTTPS 
falseHTTPHTTPHTTP 
falseHTTPSHTTPHTTPuse Rx server's default port
falseHTTPHTTPSHTTPuse originating request's port
falseHTTPSHTTPSHTTPuse Rx server's default port
trueHTTPHTTPHTTP 
trueHTTPSHTTPHTTPpartialUrl value overrides originating request protocol
trueHTTPHTTPSHTTPSpartialUrl value overrides originating request protocol
trueHTTPSHTTPSHTTPS 
Returns:
The fully formed URL; never null. If the base has an anchor and an anchor is supplied, the supplied anchor replaces the anchor in the base. If the protocol specified is not http or https, then the supplied partialUrl is returned instead.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if request is null.
MalformedURLException - if any of the pieces can't be converted to a URL.

main

public static void main(String[] args)

getUrlParameterValue

public static String getUrlParameterValue(String url,
                                          String name)
Parse the url parameter value for the supplied name from the provided url.

Parameters:
url - the url from which to parse the parameter value, not null or empty.
name - the parameter name for which to parse the value from the supplied url, not null or empty.
Returns:
the parameter value, may be null if not found.

replaceUrlParameterValue

public static String replaceUrlParameterValue(String url,
                                              String name,
                                              String value)
Replace the url parameter value for the named parameter with the supplied value. Does nothing to the url if the parameter is not found.

Parameters:
url - the url in which to replace the supplied parameter value, not null or empty.
name - the name of the parameter for which to replace the value, not null or empty.
value - the new parameter value, not null, may be empty.
Returns:
the url with the replaced parameter, never null, may be empty.
